sect1.title: Usage
sect1.para: Computes the gamma function for real arguments. The gamma function takes only a single argument y = gamma(x) where x is either a float or double array. The output vector y is the same size (and type) as x.

sect1.title: Internals
sect1.para: The gamma function is defined by the integral: \[ \Gamma(x) = \int_{0}^{\infty} e^{-t} t^{x-1} \, dt \] The gamma function obeys the interesting relationship \[ \Gamma(x) = (x-1)\Gamma(x-1), \] and for integer arguments, is equivalent to the factorial function.
